ruleset.name: jpinpoint-common_std-rules
ruleset.description: jPinpoint rule set for performance aware Java coding, sponsored by Rabobank.

rule.name: AvoidApacheCommonsFileItemNonStreaming
rule.message: Avoid memory intensive FileItem.get and FileItem.getString
rule.description: Problem: Use of FileItem.get and FileItem.getString could exhaust memory since they load the entire file into memory Solution: Use streaming methods and buffering.

property.name: xpath

rule.name: AvoidCalendarDateCreation
rule.message: A Calendar is used to create a Date or DateTime, this is expensive.
rule.description: Problem: A Calendar is a heavyweight object and expensive to create. Solution: Use 'new Date()', Java 8+ java.time.[Local/Zoned]DateTime.now() or joda time '[Local]DateTime.now()'.

property.name: xpath

rule.name: AvoidConcatInAppend
rule.message: Concatenation inside append. Use extra append.
rule.description: Concatenation of Strings is used inside an StringBuilder.append argument. Problem: Each statement with one or more +-operators creates a hidden temporary StringBuilder, a char[] and a new String object, which all have to be garbage collected. Solution: Use an extra fluent append instead of concatenation.

rule.name: AvoidConcatInLoop
rule.message: A String is concatenated in a loop. Use StringBuilder.append.
rule.description: A String is built in a loop by concatenation. Problem: Each statement with one or more +-operators creates a hidden temporary StringBuilder, a char[] and a new String object, which all have to be garbage collected. Solution: Use the StringBuilder append method.

property.name: xpath

rule.name: LimitWildcardStaticImports
rule.message: The number of static imports with a wildcard should be limited
rule.description: Importing a class statically allows you to use its public static members easily: without qualifying them with the class name. Problem: if you import too many classes statically, your code can become confusing and difficult to maintain. The default maximum = 3. Solution: Import class members individually.

property.name: max
property.description: Maximum number of allowed static imports with wildcard

rule.name: LetFieldsMeetSerializable
rule.message: Fields in a Serializable class should be serializable or transient.
rule.description: Problem: Field in a Serializable class is not serializable nor transient. When (de)serialization happens, a RuntimeException will be thrown and (de)serialization fails. Solution: make the field either transient, make its class implement Serializable or interface extend Serializable. Note: Classes extending Throwable do, by inheritance, implement Serializable, yet are excluded in this rule, since they are typically never actually serialized. An exception to this exception is when extending RemoteException, then fields should be transient or serializable.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //ClassOrInterfaceDeclaration[ImplementsList/ClassOrInterfaceType[@Image='Serializable'] or pmd-java:typeIs('java.io.Serializable') (: Throwable is the exception, except RemoteException :) and not(pmd-java:typeIs('java.lang.Throwable') and not(pmd-java:typeIs('java.rmi.RemoteException')))] (: non-transient, non-static, non-primitive fields :) //FieldDeclaration[@Transient=false() and @Static=false()][not(.//PrimitiveType)] [not(pmd-java:typeIs('java.io.Serializable')) (: and can be resolved :) and (pmd-java:typeIs('java.lang.Object')) (: if has type args, type args which are not serializable like List<String, Thread>):) and (not(exists(.//TypeArgument/ReferenceType)) or exists(.//TypeArgument/ReferenceType[not(pmd-java:typeIs('java.io.Serializable')) (: and can be resolved :) and (pmd-java:typeIs('java.lang.Object'))])) ]

rule.name: AvoidComplexLambdas
rule.message: Avoid lambda expressions with many statements or nested lambdas.
rule.description: Problem: lambda expressions with many statements or nested lambdas are hard to understand and maintain. Solution: extract the lambda expression code block into one or more well-named separate method(s).

property.name: max
property.description: Maximum number of allowed non-setter statements

rule.name: AvoidUnusedAssignments
rule.message: Avoid assignments for which the assigned value is never used.
rule.description: Problem: Assignments to variables for which the assigned value is not used because a new value is assigned before actual use, is unnecessary work and my indicate a bug. Solution: remove the first assignment and make sure that is as intended.

property.value: (: for each local variable declaration or assignment node :) (for $node in (//StatementExpression[AssignmentOperator][not(ancestor::IfStatement or ancestor::TryStatement or ancestor::SwitchStatement)]/PrimaryExpression/PrimaryPrefix/Name | //LocalVariableDeclaration/VariableDeclarator[VariableInitializer]//VariableDeclaratorId) (: match if for that node the next occurrence of ((assignment without use in same statement) union with (use) is an assignment to the var) :) return ($node[ (: assignment without use, Name is result :) ((ancestor::BlockStatement/following-sibling::BlockStatement//StatementExpression[AssignmentOperator][not(ancestor::IfStatement or ancestor::TryStatement or ancestor::SwitchStatement)]/PrimaryExpression/PrimaryPrefix/Name[@Image=$node/@Image] [not(ancestor::BlockStatement//PrimaryExpression[not(../AssignmentOperator) and (not(PrimarySuffix/Arguments) or PrimaryPrefix[contains(Name/@Image, '.')])] /PrimaryPrefix[substring-before(concat(Name/@Image, '.'), '.')=$node/@Image])] )[1] | (: use, PrimaryPrefix is result, so @Image is empty string :) (ancestor::BlockStatement/following-sibling::BlockStatement//PrimaryExpression[not(../AssignmentOperator and not(PrimarySuffix/Expression)) and (not(PrimarySuffix/Arguments) or PrimaryPrefix[contains(Name/@Image, '.')])] /PrimaryPrefix[substring-before(concat(Name/@Image, '.'), '.')=$node/@Image])[1]) (: first is the var name :) [1]/@Image = $node/@Image]) )
